item.description:
Event: Spend an hour or two rowing around Jamaica Pond and exploring the serene oasis that is part of Frederick Law Olmsted’s Emerald Necklace.

Our rowing excursion will be followed by  optional refreshments  at an eatery on Centre Street, the heart of Jamaica Plain’s shopping district.

Meet: At 11 a.m.  in the lobby of 111 Perkins St., Jamaicaway Tower, a high-rise building overlooking the intersection of Perkins and the Jamaicaway. Jamaica Plain, MA 02130. From there, we’ll walk to the pond, a short distance away. There is street parking available on Perkins Street and other nearby streets.

Cost: Everyone will share the expense of the boat rentals which are $10 an hour, per boat not per person. Most row boats fit 3 people, some can hold four or five.  There is a $5 guest fee which can be credited toward a full Mosaic membership, which costs $25.

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: Explore Jamaica Pond in Row Boats
